result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawand L Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs for any reason.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

ADDRESS INFO for Dawand L Washington
Current: W9861 County Road JJ, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2016)

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dawand L Washington in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1: 
- 9 months jail - credit for 1 day -  straight time STAYED for 2 years Probation
- Fine totaling $829.25 (includes DNA Surcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 17 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs for any reason.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Obtain HSED or GED.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dawand L Washington in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the information and enters a not guilty plea to each count.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on July 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Dawand L Washington in court with attorney Joan B Broughton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Broughton states Mr. Washington is currently in the hospital and requests an adjournment.  State does not object.    Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
